<result>
# David's Portfolio

A modern, performant portfolio website built with Next.js 15, React 19, and TypeScript. Features MDX blog support, dark mode, and a command palette for quick navigation.

## Tech Stack

- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS
- **UI Components**: Radix UI primitives with shadcn/ui
- **Content**: MDX for blog posts
- **Database**: SQLite with Drizzle ORM (for future features)
- **Animations**: Framer Motion

## Features

- Responsive design with dark/light mode
- Command palette (⌘K) for quick navigation
- MDX blog with syntax highlighting
- SEO optimized with sitemap and robots.txt
- Accessible components built on Radix UI

## Project Structure

```
src/
├── app/          # Next.js app router pages
├── components/   # React components
│   └── ui/       # shadcn/ui components
├── config/       # Site configuration
├── data/         # Static data (resume, etc.)
├── hooks/        # Custom React hooks
└── types/        # TypeScript type definitions

content/
├── blog/         # MDX blog posts
└── projects/     # Project case studies

docs/             # Documentation
lib/              # Utility functions
db/               # Database schema
```

## Development

```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

## Building

```bash
npm run build
npm run start
```
</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
</result>

import type { Metadata } from "next";
import { Geist, Geist_Mono } from "next/font/google";
import "./globals.css";
import { siteConfig } from "@/config/site";
import { Providers } from "@/components/providers";
import { MainNav } from "@/components/main-nav";
import { CommandPalette } from "@/components/command-palette";

const geist = Geist({
  variable: "--font-geist",
  subsets: ["latin"],
});

const geistMono = Geist_Mono({
  variable: "--font-geist-mono",
  subsets: ["latin"],
});

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  metadataBase: new URL(siteConfig.url),
  title: {
    default: siteConfig.name,
    template: `%s | ${siteConfig.name}`,
  },
  description: siteConfig.description,
  keywords: [
    "David Fotesco",
    "Software Engineer",
    "Full Stack Developer",
    "Web Development",
    "React",
    "Next.js",
    "TypeScript",
    "Portfolio",
  ],
  authors: [{ name: siteConfig.author.name, url: siteConfig.url }],
  creator: siteConfig.author.name,
  openGraph: {
    type: "website",
    locale: "en_US",
    url: siteConfig.url,
    title: siteConfig.name,
    description: siteConfig.description,
    siteName: siteConfig.name,
    images: [
      {
        url: `${siteConfig.url}/og.png`,
        width: 1200,
        height: 630,
        alt: siteConfig.name,
      },
    ],
  },
  twitter: {
    card: "summary_large_image",
    title: siteConfig.name,
    description: siteConfig.description,
    images: [`${siteConfig.url}/og.png`],
    creator: siteConfig.author.twitter,
  },
  robots: {
    index: true,
    follow: true,
    googleBot: {
      index: true,
      follow: true,
      "max-video-preview": -1,
      "max-image-preview": "large",
      "max-snippet": -1,
    },
  },
  icons: {
    icon: "/favicon.ico",
    shortcut: "/favicon-16x16.png",
    apple: "/apple-touch-icon.png",
  },
  manifest: `${siteConfig.url}/site.webmanifest`,
};

export default function RootLayout({
  children,
}: Readonly<{
  children: React.ReactNode;
}>) {
  return (
    <html lang="en" suppressHydrationWarning>
      <body
        className={`${geist.variable} ${geistMono.variable} min-h-screen bg-background font-sans antialiased`}
      >
        <Providers>
          <div className="relative flex min-h-screen flex-col">
            <MainNav />
            <main className="flex-1">{children}</main>
            <footer className="border-t py-6 md:py-0">
              <div className="container flex flex-col items-center justify-between gap-4 md:h-16 md:flex-row">
                <p className="text-center text-sm leading-loose text-muted-foreground md:text-left">
                  Built with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and MDX.
                </p>
              </div>
            </footer>
          </div>
          <CommandPalette />
        </Providers>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}
</parameter>
</invoke>

import Link from "next/link";
import { siteConfig } from "@/config/site";
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button";
import { ArrowRight, Github, Linkedin, Twitter } from "lucide-react";

export default function Home() {
  return (
    <div className="container flex flex-col items-center justify-center min-h-[calc(100vh-8rem)] py-12">
      <div className="flex flex-col items-center gap-6 text-center max-w-3xl">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold tracking-tight sm:text-5xl md:text-6xl lg:text-7xl">
          Hi, I&apos;m{" "}
          <span className="bg-gradient-to-r from-primary to-primary/60 bg-clip-text text-transparent">
            David
          </span>
        </h1>
        <p className="text-xl text-muted-foreground max-w-[42rem] leading-normal sm:text-2xl sm:leading-8">
          {siteConfig.description}
        </p>
        <div className="flex gap-4">
          <Button asChild>
            <Link href="/projects">
              View Projects <ArrowRight className="ml-2 h-4 w-4" />
            </Link>
          </Button>
          <Button variant="outline" asChild>
            <Link href="/blog">Read Blog</Link>
          </Button>
        </div>
        <div className="flex gap-4 mt-4">
          <Button variant="ghost" size="icon" asChild>
            <a
              href={siteConfig.links.github}
              target="_blank"
              rel="noopener noreferrer"
              aria-label="GitHub"
            >
              <Github className="h-5 w-5" />
            </a>
          </Button>
          <Button variant="ghost" size="icon" asChild>
            <a
              href={siteConfig.links.twitter}
              target="_blank"
              rel="noopener noreferrer"
              aria-label="Twitter"
            >
              <Twitter className="h-5 w-5" />
            </a>
          </Button>
          <Button variant="ghost" size="icon" asChild>
            <a
              href={siteConfig.links.linkedin}
              target="_blank"
              rel="noopener noreferrer"
              aria-label="LinkedIn"
            >
              <Linkedin className="h-5 w-5" />
            </a>
          </Button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

<result>
import fs from "fs";
import path from "path";
import { BlogPost, Project } from "@/types";

const contentDirectory = path.join(process.cwd(), "content");

export async function getBlogPosts(): Promise<BlogPost[]> {
  const blogDir = path.join(contentDirectory, "blog");
  const files = fs.readdirSync(blogDir);

  const posts = await Promise.all(
    files
      .filter((file) => file.endsWith(".mdx"))
      .map(async (file) => {
        const slug = file.replace(".mdx", "");
        const { metadata } = await import(`@/../../content/blog/${file}`);
        return {
          slug,
          ...metadata,
        } as BlogPost;
      })
  );

  return posts.sort(
    (a, b) => new Date(b.date).getTime() - new Date(a.date).getTime()
  );
}

export async function getBlogPost(
  slug: string
): Promise<{ metadata: BlogPost; default: React.ComponentType }> {
  const { metadata, default: Content } = await import(
    `@/../../content/blog/${slug}.mdx`
  );
  return { metadata: { slug, ...metadata }, default: Content };
}

export async function getProjects(): Promise<Project[]> {
  const projectsDir = path.join(contentDirectory, "projects");
  const files = fs.readdirSync(projectsDir);

  const projects = await Promise.all(
    files
      .filter((file) => file.endsWith(".mdx"))
      .map(async (file) => {
        const slug = file.replace(".mdx", "");
        const { metadata } = await import(`@/../../content/projects/${file}`);
        return {
          slug,
          ...metadata,
        } as Project;
      })
  );

  return projects.sort((a, b) => a.order - b.order);
}
</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
</result>

export interface BlogPost {
  slug: string;
  title: string;
  description: string;
  date: string;
  tags: string[];
  published: boolean;
}

export interface Project {
  slug: string;
  title: string;
  description: string;
  technologies: string[];
  github?: string;
  demo?: string;
  image?: string;
  order: number;
}

<result>
# Agent Guidelines for Portfolio Project

## Project Overview
This is a Next.js 15 portfolio website with MDX blog support and TypeScript.

## Key Conventions

### Code Style
- Use TypeScript for all files
- Follow existing patterns in the codebase
- Use Tailwind CSS for styling
- Prefer composition over inheritance

### File Structure
- Pages go in `src/app/`
- Components go in `src/components/`
- UI primitives go in `src/components/ui/`
- Types go in `src/types/`
- Utilities go in `lib/`

### Component Guidelines
- Use functional components with TypeScript
- Export types alongside components when needed
- Follow Radix UI patterns for accessibility
- Use `cn()` utility for conditional classes

### Testing Changes
- Run `npm run build` to verify no TypeScript errors
- Test in browser for visual changes
- Check both light and dark modes

### Git Conventions
- Use conventional commits (feat:, fix:, docs:, etc.)
- Keep commits focused and atomic
- Write clear commit messages

## Common Tasks

### Adding a Blog Post
1. Create new `.mdx` file in `content/blog/`
2. Include required frontmatter: title, description, date, tags, published

### Adding a Component
1. Create component in `src/components/`
2. Export from index if creating a new directory
3. Add TypeScript types as needed
</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
</result>

Now I have a solid understanding of the codebase. Let me summarize:

## Codebase Overview

This is a **Next.js 15 portfolio website** for David Fotesco, built with modern web technologies.

### Technology Stack
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router and Turbopack
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui components
- **UI Primitives**: Radix UI
- **Content**: MDX for blog posts and projects
- **Database**: SQLite with Drizzle ORM (prepared for future features)
- **Animations**: Framer Motion

### Project Structure

```
/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/
├── src/
│   ├── app/              # Next.js App Router pages
│   │   ├── layout.tsx    # Root layout with providers, nav, footer
│   │   ├── page.tsx      # Home page
│   │   ├── blog/         # Blog listing and individual posts
│   │   └── projects/     # Projects page
│   ├── components/       # React components
│   │   ├── ui/           # shadcn/ui components (button, command, etc.)
│   │   ├── main-nav.tsx  # Navigation component
│   │   ├── command-palette.tsx  # Cmd+K navigation
│   │   └── providers.tsx # Theme and other providers
│   ├── config/site.ts    # Site configuration
│   ├── data/             # Static data (resume)
│   ├── hooks/            # Custom React hooks
│   └── types/            # TypeScript definitions
├── content/
│   ├── blog/             # MDX blog posts
│   └── projects/         # Project case studies
├── lib/
│   ├── mdx.ts            # MDX content loading utilities
│   ├── db.ts             # Database connection
│   └── utils.ts          # Utility functions
├── docs/                 # Documentation
└── db/                   # Database schema
```

### Key Features
1. **Command Palette**: Quick navigation via Cmd+K
2. **Dark/Light Mode**: Theme switching support
3. **MDX Blog**: Blog posts written in MDX with frontmatter
4. **Responsive Design**: Mobile-friendly layout
5. **SEO Optimized**: Sitemap, robots.txt, Open Graph metadata

### Critical Files for Implementation

- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/app/layout.tsx` - Root layout, global structure
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/config/site.ts` - Site configuration and navigation
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/lib/mdx.ts` - Content loading utilities
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/components/main-nav.tsx` - Navigation component
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/types/index.ts` - TypeScript type definitions
